column4: i don't know how to check if i have a separate partition for /home
run the mount command and look for home. If it shows up it's on a separate partition
then /home is not on a separate partition
why don't you burn the data to CD?
presume you have only one machine?
could i use a modem cable?
Than your better of pushing your files to the second machine via ftp, just make a tarball.
i don't know how to connect the two computers together
if you get an ethernet switch you can hook up both machines to the switch and set up a LAN should take about 15 minutes.
if you just get a switch it should be less than $50.
what about 'partitioning', ?  would that be easy?
I've never trusted the repartitioning, too chicken to try. Other people may have done this and have good experience.
but do you know how?  i'd like to try- i think it's worth risking my files (because it is my last option before i decide to just lose my files)
IMHO your best option is to invest in an ethernet switch and save your files on your second machine. No, I don't know how to repartition but this was being discussed here at the same time, gparted?
